creator: troxelso@nswccd.navy.mil
text:
When using a simple RewriteRule such as 

RewriteRule *. /cgi-bin/prog.pl

Then internally redirection change a POST request method to GET and any form 
parameters are not returned.  I understand an external redirect will do this 
however an internal redirect i think should retain the original POST method. 

Also noticed the same issue with DirectoryIndex.  For example

<Directory /mydir>
 DirectoryIndex /cgi-bin/prog.pl 
</Directory>

Will do an internal redirect and POST -> GET 

I did try 

RewriteRule *. /cgi-bin/prog.pl [E=REQUEST_METHOD:POST] and got an extra ENV 
variable REDIRECT_REQUEST_METHOD = POST but POST parameters are still lost.

creator: troxelso@nswccd.navy.mil
text:
I just tested the DirectoryIndex with Apache/1.3.27 and it does retain the
request method across the redirect.

Traced the issue down to a trailing slash problem...

If the form tag is

<form action="/flexcart" method=POST>

Then the POST is translated into a GET

If the form tag includes the slash such as

<form action="/flexcart/" method=POST>


The indeed the POST remains a POST for both DirectoryIndex and RewriteRule.

Not sure if this is bug or expected. If not sorry for congesting the airways.
creator: troxelso@nswccd.navy.mil
slive@apache.org
text:
Ahhh... Not a bug.  It is probably not apache changing the request method
at all.  It is the browser that is changing the method when it receives
the 302 redirect.

By the way, in the future we would request that you wait a day after
posting to the users list and newsgroup before submitting a bug report.

Thanks.
